required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Homoarginine Supplementation in Patients After Stroke

brief_summary.textblock: This study represents a follow-up of the previous study "Single and Multiple Doses of an Oral Formulation of L-Homoarginine in Healthy Human Subjects" (NCT02675660). This study will evaluate the applicability of an oral formulation of L-homoarginine to normalize homoarginine blood levels in patients with acute ischemic stroke.

primary_outcome.description: Normalization of homoarginine serum concentration to levels >2.1 umol/L.

secondary_outcome.description: Intima-media thickness (IMT) measured at both common carotid arteries using an edge detection system. Plaques are defined as protrusion of ≥1.5 mm in common, internal and external carotid artery.

secondary_outcome.measure: National Institute of Health Stroke Scale
secondary_outcome.description: National Institute of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) will be assessed by a neurologist. The NIHSS is composed of 11 items, each of which scores a specific ability between a 0 (normal) and 4 (maximum impairment). The maximum possible score is 42, with the minimum score being a 0.
Modified Ranking Scale (mRS) is a scale for measuring the degree of disability of a stroke patients. The scale runs from 0 (perfect health) to 6 (death).

arm_group.description: placebo capsules containing lactose - oral once weekly administration for six month
125 mg L-homoarginine supplement - oral once weekly administration for six month

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ischemic stroke (CT or MRI), high-risk transient ischemic attack (ABCD2-score >= 4) or acute central retinal artery occlusion
- serum homoarginine </= 2.1 umol/L
- signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- no acute stroke
- serum homoarginine > 2.1 umol/L
- heart failure (NYHA > 1)
- chronic kidney disease (GFR <60 mL/min)
- not competent
- pregnancy, lactation
- no or withdrawn signed informed consent

reference.citation: Atzler D, Schönhoff M, Cordts K, Ortland I, Hoppe J, Hummel FC, Gerloff C, Jaehde U, Jagodzinski A, Böger RH, Choe CU, Schwedhelm E. Oral supplementation with L-homoarginine in young volunteers. Br J Clin Pharmacol. 2016 Dec;82(6):1477-1485. doi: 10.1111/bcp.13068. Epub 2016 Sep 20.
